qsurvey
  • Reference

The qsurvey package: overview

qsurvey is a toolkit for working with the Qualtrics platform and its survey data in R. Download responses and designs directly into a session, then:

Details

  • Examine branching, randomization, and question attributes like validation
  • Represent survey flows as directed graphs for interactive review in Shiny
  • Map question ids to labels and translate between choice codes and descriptions in response data

The package works by sending requests to the Qualtrics API. For authentication, an API key is needed. See the Qualtrics documentation. The key should be set with the environment variable QUALTRICS_KEY (see Sys.setenv) or the key_from_file function.

Functionality focuses on testing and review of surveys, before fielding, and analysis of responses afterward. To access API actions that are not available through higher-level package functions, use qget, qpost, or request.

I'm aware of two other Qualtrics packages. Jason Bryer wrote one in 2012. Eric Green forked and revised it for v2.3 of the Qualtrics API, most recently in 2014. I started qsurvey while staffing MIT PERL.
